Punta Mita

Mexico's Riviera Nayarit crown jewel — where world-class resorts meet pristine Pacific beaches and hidden islands

About Punta Mita

Punta Mita is Mexico's most exclusive beach destination, a private peninsula in the Riviera Nayarit with luxury resorts like Four Seasons and St. Regis, championship golf, whale watching, and the famous Marietas Islands nearby. It offers the ultimate Pacific Coast escape.

Practical Information

Frequently Asked Questions About Punta Mita

Do I need to stay at a resort to visit Punta Mita?
The gated resort community requires staying at an affiliated property or booking a golf tee time/dining reservation. However, Punta de Mita village and its beaches are public. Budget travelers stay in the village and enjoy the same ocean without the luxury price tag.
When is whale watching season?
Humpback whales are in Banderas Bay from December to March, with peak activity in January and February. Morning boat tours offer the best conditions and sightings.
How do I visit the Hidden Beach (Marietas Islands)?
Access to Hidden Beach is strictly controlled with limited daily permits. Book with a certified operator several days in advance. Even if you can't access Hidden Beach, the islands offer excellent snorkeling and diving.
How far is Punta Mita from Puerto Vallarta?
Punta Mita is about 45 minutes from Puerto Vallarta International Airport (PVR) and the same from downtown Puerto Vallarta. The scenic drive follows the coast of Banderas Bay.
